perturbation.original_text: 1.2 TERM. The term of this Agreement will commence on January 1, 1998 (the "Effective Date") and will end on December 31, 1998. Unless either party gives the other at least ninety days' prior written notice that it has elected not to extend the term of this Agreement beyond December 31, 1998, the term of this Agreement will be automatically extended until December 31, 1999. Thereafter this Agreement will automatically be renewed for successive additional periods of one year, unless either party gives notice of cancellation on or before October 1 of any such year.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 TERM. The term of this Agreement will commence on January 1, 1998 (the "Effective Date") and will end on December 31, 1998. The extension of this agreement is subjected to negotiations from both parties prior to the end of the initial term. Thereafter this Agreement will automatically be renewed for successive additional periods of one year, unless either party gives notice of cancellation on or before October 1 of any such year.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated the contract auto-renews unless either party provides a 90 days notice. The modified version states that an extension is based on negotiations from both parties which contradicts the auto-renewal clause.

perturbation.original_text: 4.2 BINDING NATURE AND ASSIGNMENT. This Agreement shall be binding on the parties and their respective successors and assigns, but neither party may, or shall have the power to, assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 BINDING NATURE AND ASSIGNMENT. This Agreement shall be binding on the parties and their respective successors and assigns. Either party can freely assign this agreement to any of its affiliates without consent. Any other assignments require written consent, which may be withheld at the assigning party's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that neither party can assign the agreement without prior written consent. The modified version contradicts this by stating either party can freely assign to its affiliates, and the assigning party can withhold consent at their sole discretion

perturbation.original_text: 4.10 AMENDMENTS. No amendment, change, waiver, or discharge of this Agreement shall be valid unless in writing and signed by an authorized representative of the party against which such amendment, change, waiver, or discharge is sought to be enforced.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.10 AMENDMENTS. No amendment, change, waiver, or discharge of this Agreement shall be valid unless approved by the president of each party. Verbal agreements between the parties can supersede the terms of this contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that amendments must be in writing. The modified version introduces a contradiction by stating that verbal agreements can supersede the written contract.
